garish:
过分艳丽的 
too bright or colorful
intrinsic:
固有的；内在的；本身的 
belonging to or part of the real nature of something/somebody
indolent:
懒惰的 
not liking to work or be active
miserly:
吝啬的 
hating to spend money

极少的，太小的 
very small or too small in amount
ferocity:
凶残；猛烈 
the state of being frightening and violent
droop:
下垂 
to sink, bend, or hang down
anarchism:
无政府主义 
a belief that government and laws are not necessary
extol:
颂扬，赞美 
to praise (someone or something) highly
superintendent:
部门 主管，负责人 
a person who directs or manages a place, department, organization, etc. 
117
anomalous:
异常的，反常的，例外的 
not expected or usual
sagacious:
智慧的 
having or showing an ability to understand difficult ideas and situations and to make good 
decisions; wise
seditious:
煽动性的 
the crime of saying, writing, or doing something that encourages people to disobey their government
canyon:
峡谷 
a deep valley with steep rock sides and often a stream or river flowing through it
akin:
相似的；类似的 
similar to
thaw:
融解 
to stop being frozen or to cause (something) to stop being frozen

解冻，融雪 
to become warm enough that snow and ice melt
posthumous:
死后的 
happening, done, or published after someone's death
benediction:
基督教的祝福，祝祷 
a Christian prayer of blessing
enchant:
使陶醉，使入迷 
to attract and hold the attention of (someone) by being interesting, pretty, etc.

对 施魔法 
to put a magic spell on (someone or something)
grandiose:
浮夸的 
seeming to be impressive or intended to be impressive but not really possible or practical
articulate:
口齿清楚的，发音清晰的 
able to express ideas clearly and effectively in speech or writing

清楚地表达 
to express (something, such as an idea) in words
solidarity:
团结一致 
a feeling of unity between people who have the same interests, goals, etc.
cryptic:
隐秘的，神秘的 
difficult to understand; having or seeming to have a hidden meaning 
118
commensurate:
在大小、重要性、质量等方面相称的，相当的 
matching something in size, importance, quality, etc.
comply:
遵从，顺从 
to do what you have been asked or ordered to do
competence:
能力 
the ability to do something well
monarch:
君主 
a person (such as a king or queen) who rules a kingdom or empire
influx:
大量涌入 
the arrival of a large number of people
redress:
纠正，矫正，改正 
to correct (something that is unfair or wrong)
prosperity:
繁荣 
the state of being successful usually by making a lot of money
retention:
保留 
the act of keeping someone or something

记忆力 
the ability to remember things easily or for a long time
repress:
抑制；镇压 
to control (someone or something) by force
tinge:
微量，少许，几分 颜色、感情或性质 
a slight color, flavor, or quality

给 稍微着色 
to give a small amount of color to (something)
relentless:
不间断的 
continuing without becoming weaker, less severe, etc.

无情的 
remaining strict or determined
obsolete:
过时的 
no longer used because something newer exists
mischievous:
恶作剧的 
showing a playful desire to cause trouble
humidity:
湿度 
the quality of being humid
resumption:
恢复；重新开始 
an act of starting something again after it has stopped; an act of resuming something
stringent:
严格的 
very strict or severe
disseminate:
传播 
to cause (something, such as information) to go to many people
correlate:
有相关性 
to have a close connection with something

使显示联系，使相互关联 
to show that there is a close connection between two or more facts, figures, etc.
lodging:
寄宿舍；租住的房间 
a place where a person (such as a traveler) can stay for usually a short period of time; a 
place to sleep
dreary:
枯燥无味的，沉闷的 
boring and making you feel unhappy
awe:
使敬畏 
to fill (someone) with awe

敬畏 
a strong feeling of fear or respect and also wonder
unscrupulous:
不道德的 
not honest or fair; doing things that are wrong, dishonest, or illegal
deter:
制止，阻止 
to prevent (something) from happening

使打消念头 
to cause (someone) to decide not to do something
aggrandize:
加大 
to make great or greater
adrift:
船 漂浮着的 
floating on the water without being tied to anything or controlled by anyone

茫然的 
without guidance, purpose, or support
decorum:
有礼；得体；庄重 
correct or proper behavior that shows respect and good manners
dignified:
有尊严的 
serious and somewhat formal; having or showing dignity
concede:
让步 
to give away (something) usually in an unwilling way
imprudent:
轻率的 
not wise or sensible; not prudent
invoke:
援引 
to refer to (something) in support of your ideas

求助于法律等 
to ask for help or protection from (something or someone)
ambiguous:
模棱两可的，含糊不清的 
doubtful or uncertain especially from obscurity or indistinctness
ample:
丰富的 
having or providing enough or more than enough of what is needed 
wreak havoc on 严重破坏 
serious damage
complacent:
自满的 
satisfied with how things are and not wanting to change them
immutable:
不可改变的 
not capable of or susceptible to change
inalienable:
不能转让的，不能放弃的 
impossible to take away or give up
stink:
恶臭 
a very bad smell

散发出恶臭 
to have a very bad smell
construe:
理解 
to understand (an action, event, remark, etc.) in a particular way 
121
immunity:
免除，豁免 
special protection from what is required for most people by law

免疫力 
the power to keep yourself from being affected by a disease
feudal:
封建的 
of or relating to feudalism
etch:
蚀刻 
to produce a pattern, design, etc., by using a powerful liquid (called an acid) to cut the 
surface of metal or glass
repel:
击退；驱逐 
to drive or force (an attack or attacker) back or away.

推开；赶走；驱除 
to drive, push or keep something away

使恐惧；使厌恶 
to make somebody feel horror or disgust

排斥；相斥 
to cause to move back by force or influence
rage:
猛烈地继续，激烈进行，肆虐 
to happen or continue in a destructive, violent, or intense way
unrest:
动荡 
a situation in which many of the people in a country are angry and hold protests or act violently
hue:
色彩，色度 
a color or a shade of a color
redeem:
补救；弥补；掩饰 之不足 
to compensate for the faults or bad aspects of (something)

兑现，赎回 
to gain or regain possession of (something) in exchange for payment

履行 
fulfill or carry out (a pledge or promise)
infringe:
违反法律，规章等 
to do something that does not obey or follow (a rule, law, etc.)

侵犯，侵害 
to wrongly limit or restrict (something, such as another person's rights)
avow:
声明；公开宣称 
to say firmly and often publicly what your opinion is, what you think is true, etc. 
122
implement:
器具 
an object used to do work

实施，执行 
to begin to do or use (something, such as a plan); to make (something) active or effective
heed:
留心 
to pay attention to (advice, a warning, etc.)
tribute:
颂词 
something that you say, give, or do to show respect or affection for someone
quintessential:
精髓的 
perfectly typical or representative of a particular kind of person or thing
unwarranted:
无根据的，未经授权的 
not necessary or appropriate; not warranted;unjustified
degradation:
堕落；落泊，潦倒 的境况 
a situation in which somebody has lost all self-respect and the respect of other people

毁坏，恶化 过程 
the process of something being damaged or made worse
spectacle:
精彩的表演；壮观的场面 
a performance or an event that is very impressive and exciting to look at
mortgage:
抵押，抵押贷款 
a legal agreement in which a person borrows money to buy property (such as a house) and 
pays back the money over a period of years
manipulate:
操纵，操控 
to move or control (something) with your hands or by using a machine
flimsy:
劣质的；不结实的 
badly made and not strong enough for the purpose for which it is used

材料 薄而易损坏的 
(of material) thin and easily torn

不足信的 
difficult to believe
